Alternatively, it might be simpler to cram it into the markup below...

I prefer to break out any anonymous functions that show up in templates (when possible). I think it helps keep the mental model in order when skimming code, and benefits refactoring. For instance, I just added handler caching without having to add any complexity to the template markup.
Anonymous functions are fired on every render too, which is a (very) slight perf hit, iirc it's better practice to not use anon functions in renders - but I could be wrong!
